Explanations about Options.--permanent: Set the target of a permanent zone. target is one of: default, ACCEPT, DROP, REJECT
Explanations about Options.--reload:
Reload firewall rules and keep state information. Current permanent configuration will
 become new runtime configuration, i.e. all runtime only changes done until reload are
 lost with reload if they have not been also in permanent configuration.

Top-3 Scripts:
su_184540: #!/bin/sh
if [ "$IFACE" = "br0" ] || [ "$IFACE" = "eth0" ]; then
  if [ -n "$(ip addr show br0 | grep '^ *inet ')" ] 2>/dev/null &&
     [ -n "$(ip addr show eth0 | grep '^ *inet ')" ] 2>/dev/null; then
    /etc/init.d/local/my_firewall_script
  fi
fi

Explanations about Options.-p:
Probe rpcbind on host using version 2 of the rpcbind protocol, and display a list of
 all registered RPC programs. If host is not specified, it defaults to the local
 host. Note: Version 2 of the rpcbind protocol was previously known as the
 portmapper protocol.
